name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we can compare to the pyrazole base, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The two phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the trimethylphenyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The pyrazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius.
